Administration.text:
Type:
Antiplatelet
Dosage Forms:
Routes of Administration: Oral
Common Trade Names: Ticlid

Special_Populations.text:
Pregnancy Rating
: B
Lactation risk
: Infant risk cannot be ruled out
Renal dosing:
Hepatic dosing: may have increased bleeding risk

Contraindications.text:
Allergy to class/drug
Hematopoietic disorders (e.g. neutropenia, thrombocytopenia, or past history of TTP or aplastic anemia)
Active bleeding
Severe liver disease

Serious.text: Aplastic anemia, pancytopenia, agranulocytosis, pancytopenia, thrombocytopenia, neutorpenia, TTP

Common.text:
Rash
Nausea, diarrhea, abdominal pain
Hemorrhage
Leukopenia
Dizziness

Serious.text: Aplastic anemia, pancytopenia, agranulocytosis, pancytopenia, thrombocytopenia, neutorpenia, TTP

Common.text:
Rash
Nausea, diarrhea, abdominal pain
Hemorrhage
Leukopenia
Dizziness

Rash
Nausea, diarrhea, abdominal pain
Hemorrhage
Leukopenia
Dizziness

Pharmacology.text:
Half-life: 4-5 days
Metabolism: Hepatic
Excretion: Mostly renal

Mechanism_of_Action.text: Prevents ADP from stimulating platelet-fibrinogen binding, blocking platelet aggregation
